availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Reeves (Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Penelope B. Reeves. Father of Mary Ann Reeves, George W. Reeves, Susan J. Reeves, William B. Reeves, Martha H. Reeves, and Emily B. Reeves. Sheriff in Ballard County in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1850 and thirteen in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 280A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 124. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 165. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Lovelaceville District, p. 21. Find A Grave, "William Harrison Reeves (1814-1889)," Memorial #64004722, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=64004722&ref=acom (accessed September 21, 2017).
